name: dealii

conflicts.name: +gsl
conflicts.description: The interface to gsl is supported from version 8.5.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~gsl

conflicts.name: +python
conflicts.description: The interface to python is supported from version 8.5.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~python

conflicts.name: +assimp
conflicts.description: The interface to assimp is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~assimp

conflicts.name: +gmsh
conflicts.description: The interface to gmsh is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~gmsh

conflicts.name: +nanoflann
conflicts.description: The interface to nanoflann is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~nanoflann

conflicts.name: +nanoflann
conflicts.description: The interface to Nanoflann was removed from version 9.3.0. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~nanoflann

conflicts.name: +scalapack
conflicts.description: The interface to scalapack is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~scalapack

conflicts.name: +scalapack
conflicts.description: To enable scalapack it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +sundials
conflicts.description: The interface to sundials is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~sundials

conflicts.name: +adol-c
conflicts.description: The interface to adol-c is supported from version 9.0.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~adol-c

conflicts.name: +adol-c
conflicts.description: Symbol clash between the ADOL-C library and Netcdf.

conflicts.name: +adol-c
conflicts.description: Symbol clash between the ADOL-C library and Trilinos SEACAS Chaco.

conflicts.name: +adol-c
conflicts.description: Symbol clash between the ADOL-C library and Trilinos Netcdf.

conflicts.name: +adol-c
conflicts.description: Symbol clash between the ADOL-C library and Trilinos parallel Netcdf.

conflicts.name: +ginkgo
conflicts.description: The interface to ginkgo is supported from version 9.1.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~ginkgo

conflicts.name: +symengine
conflicts.description: The interface to symengine is supported from version 9.1.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~symengine

conflicts.name: +simplex
conflicts.description: The interface to simplex is supported from version 9.3.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~simplex

conflicts.name: +arborx
conflicts.description: The interface to arborx is supported from version 9.3.0 onwards. Please explicitly disable this variant via ~arborx

conflicts.name: +arpack
conflicts.description: To enable arpack it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +hdf5
conflicts.description: To enable hdf5 it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +netcdf
conflicts.description: To enable netcdf it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +p4est
conflicts.description: To enable p4est it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +petsc
conflicts.description: To enable petsc it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +slepc
conflicts.description: To enable slepc it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

conflicts.name: +slepc
conflicts.description: It is not possible to enable slepc interfaces without petsc.

conflicts.name: +trilinos
conflicts.description: To enable trilinos it is necessary to build deal.II with MPI support enabled.

variants.name: cxxstd
variants.description: Compile using the specified C++ standard

variants.name: arpack
variants.description: Compile with Arpack and PArpack (only with MPI)

variants.name: slepc
variants.description: Compile with Slepc (only with Petsc and MPI)

description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
XBLAS is a reference implementation for extra precision BLAS. XBLAS is a
reference implementation for the dense and banded BLAS routines, along
with extended and mixed precision version. Extended precision is only
used internally; input and output arguments remain the same as in the
existing BLAS. Extra precisions is implemented as double-double (i.e.,
128-bit total, 106-bit significand). Mixed precision permits some
input/output arguments of different types (mixing real and complex) or
precisions (mixing single and double). This implementation is proof of
concept, and no attempt was made to optimize performance; performance
should be as good as straightforward but careful code written by hand.

dependencies.name: boost
dependencies.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependencies.name: bzip2
dependencies.description:
bzip2 is a freely available, patent free high-quality data compressor.
It typically compresses files to within 10% to 15% of the best available
techniques (the PPM family of statistical compressors), whilst being
around twice as fast at compression and six times faster at
decompression.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description: OpenBLAS: An optimized BLAS library

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: suite-sparse
dependencies.description: SuiteSparse is a suite of sparse matrix algorithms

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description: Virtual package for the Message Passing Interface.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: adol-c
dependencies.description:
A package for the automatic differentiation of first and higher
derivatives of vector functions in C and C++ programs by operator
overloading.

dependencies.name: arborx
dependencies.description: ArborX is a performance-portable library for geometric search

dependencies.name: arpack-ng
dependencies.description:
ARPACK-NG is a collection of Fortran77 subroutines designed to solve
large scale eigenvalue problems. Important Features: * Reverse
Communication Interface. * Single and Double Precision Real Arithmetic
Versions for Symmetric, Non-symmetric, Standard or Generalized Problems.
* Single and Double Precision Complex Arithmetic Versions for Standard
or Generalized Problems. * Routines for Banded Matrices - Standard or
Generalized Problems. * Routines for The Singular Value Decomposition. *
Example driver routines that may be used as templates to implement
numerous Shift-Invert strategies for all problem types, data types and
precision. This project is a joint project between Debian, Octave and
Scilab in order to provide a common and maintained version of arpack.
Indeed, no single release has been published by Rice university for the
last few years and since many software (Octave, Scilab, R, Matlab...)
forked it and implemented their own modifications, arpack-ng aims to
tackle this by providing a common repository and maintained versions.
arpack-ng is replacing arpack almost everywhere.

dependencies.name: assimp
dependencies.description:
Open Asset Import Library (Assimp) is a portable Open Source library to
import various well-known 3D model formats in a uniform manner.

dependencies.name: doxygen
dependencies.description:
Doxygen is the de facto standard tool for generating documentation from
annotated C++ sources, but it also supports other popular programming
languages such as C, Objective-C, C#, PHP, Java, Python, IDL (Corba,
Microsoft, and UNO/OpenOffice flavors), Fortran, VHDL, Tcl, and to some
extent D..

dependencies.name: graphviz
dependencies.description: Graph Visualization Software

dependencies.name: ginkgo
dependencies.description:
High-performance linear algebra library for manycore systems, with a
focus on sparse solution of linear systems.

dependencies.name: gmsh
dependencies.description:
Gmsh is a free 3D finite element grid generator with a built-in CAD
engine and post-processor. Its design goal is to provide a fast, light
and user-friendly meshing tool with parametric input and advanced
visualization capabilities. Gmsh is built around four modules: geometry,
mesh, solver and post-processing. The specification of any input to
these modules is done either interactively using the graphical user
interface or in ASCII text files using Gmsh's own scripting language.

dependencies.name: gsl
dependencies.description:
The GNU Scientific Library (GSL) is a numerical library for C and C++
programmers. It is free software under the GNU General Public License.
The library provides a wide range of mathematical routines such as
random number generators, special functions and least-squares fitting.
There are over 1000 functions in total with an extensive test suite.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: metis
dependencies.description:
METIS is a set of serial programs for partitioning graphs, partitioning
finite element meshes, and producing fill reducing orderings for sparse
matrices. The algorithms implemented in METIS are based on the
multilevel recursive-bisection, multilevel k-way, and multi-constraint
partitioning schemes.

dependencies.name: muparser
dependencies.description: C++ math expression parser library.

dependencies.name: nanoflann
dependencies.description: a C++ header-only library for Nearest Neighbor (NN) search wih KD-trees.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: netcdf-cxx
dependencies.description:
Deprecated C++ compatibility bindings for NetCDF. These do NOT read or
write NetCDF-4 files, and are no longer maintained by Unidata.
Developers should migrate to current NetCDF C++ bindings, in Spack
package netcdf-cxx4.

dependencies.name: oce
dependencies.description:
Open CASCADE Community Edition: patches/improvements/experiments
contributed by users over the official Open CASCADE library.

dependencies.name: p4est
dependencies.description:
Dynamic management of a collection (a forest) of adaptive octrees in
parallel

dependencies.name: petsc
dependencies.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for
parallel distributed memory machines. It depends on external libraries
including BLAS and LAPACK for Linear Algebra computations. AMD's
optimized version of ScaLAPACK enables using BLIS and LibFLAME library
that have optimized dense matrix functions and solvers for AMD EPYC
processor family CPUs.

dependencies.name: slepc
dependencies.description: Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations.

dependencies.name: sundials
dependencies.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)

dependencies.name: trilinos
dependencies.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependencies.name: symengine
dependencies.description: SymEngine is a fast symbolic manipulation library, written in C++.

dependencies.name: tbb
dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.

dependent_to.name: dftfe
dependent_to.description: Real-space DFT calculations using Finite Elements

dependent_to.name: xsdk
dependent_to.description:
Xsdk is a suite of Department of Energy (DOE) packages for numerical
simulation. This is a Spack bundle package that installs the xSDK
packages

dependent_to.name: aspect
dependent_to.description:
Parallel and extensible Finite Element code to simulate convection in
the Earth's mantle and elsewhere.
